description: Loved the food. Easy picnic material.
author: Jazmin H.

description:
When all else fails, Zona Rosa.

Haight street gets crowded. I don't wanna wait in line with my friends while starving, and feel unsatisfied after I'm done eating. Zona Rosa never has a line. The food isn't great, but it's competent and makes you full. I would recommend getting a burrito every time. I like a regular carne asada burrito. 

Good service, large portions, and great prices.
author: Keegan S.

description:
My daughter lives in San Francisco so when we come to visit from Hawaii, this place is our first stop. Awesome selection of meats, 3 kinds of beans and all the extras that go into a delicious burrito. Large portions, the staff is A+, clean dining area and good prices.
On the day we leave we make sure to pick up some burritos to take home to family and friends. Always a hit even 7 hours later!
author: Angie H.

description:
Authentic Mexican food on Haight Street

I had two different types of tacos - beef and chicken. It also came with nachos. It was really good, really hit the spot. Staff were friendly, service was fast and freshly made. Everything is reasonably priced.

Cash only, but there's also an ATM onsite.
author: Vincent H.

description:
Mexican food is good medicine for all kinds of ailments. I'm not sure that's true of other kinds of food and this is coming from a Korean guy. Headache? Have a taco. Appendicitis? Have a burrito. AIDS? Make it a Super Burrito. But Mexican food helps for emotional pain too. Emotional pain can hurt more sometimes, because it is very real and it lasts longer. Sometimes it lasts your entire life. Zona Rosa is good medicine. 

In my memories San Francisco is forever cold and windy with a slate grey caul blocking the city off from the pleasant rays of the sun. I don't believe sunny days happen in San Francisco--contrary to the opening credits of 90s sitcom Full House. In real life the Tanner Family would suffer from seasonal affective disorder. 

The first time I walked into Zona Rosa, the rain outside was coming down like a curtain of mist and I walked into it and it saturated my clothes and I walked around the Haight smelling like wet clothes that had been molding in the washing machine overnight. 

I had been shambling down the street, mumbling profanities under my breath, looking like any random homeless person. My face was pale and sweaty, but I forced a friendly smile though I wasn't smiling inside. The big man at the counter with the tattoos covering both his arms took my order--a carnitas Super Burrito and a can of Coca Cola. He nodded in acknowledgment and turned to the flattop grill and went to work. This is very good work, feeding the motley assortment of customers that inhabit the Haight. These are people that walk right up to your face and tell you to "fuck off," without any provocation, but they're hurting very badly and you shouldn't hold it against them. You were just the closest person for them to scream at. I respect Zona Rosa for doing this very good work.

I love the openness of a true taqueria like Zona Rosa. There's nothing to hide here. No one is fucking with your food in the back. You can look right over the counter and watch your food being prepared on the flattop. I love to watch my burrito come to life before my eyes like a little newborn baby swaddled in a tortilla blanket. Then I eat my baby and I cry when it is gone.

As the big man assembled my burrito baby, I slipped slowly on my Coke, chewing on every sip, and felt myself come back to life. Then my burrito arrived. Meat and carbs packed into a ten inch tortilla capsule. It's everything I need to feel good. Life is good at Zona Rosa.

Best regards from your friend in fun,
Philip C.

P.S. The carnitas here is the right combination of crisp, tender and savory. This is how carnitas exists in my dreams, but I don't believe many taquerias do it right like they do at Zona Rosa. Apparently dreams do come true.
author: Philip C.

description: Came in randomly while walking around Haight . The burritos were amazing. Coming from San Diego, I have high expectations in mexican food. But this place hit the spot. The place was clean and simple; a few flies but that could be expected. Definitely a lucky find.
author: Yesenia J.

description: I love Zona Rosa. They easily make the best burrito in the Haight and the surrounding neighborhoods. I've been coming here for 10 years and they've never ever disappointed me. I typically get the carne asada super burrito, but TBH everything else is good too.  Everyone that works here is chill AF and super nice. And almost every time I come in they seem to just have finished a fresh batch of tortilla chips. It's prob a coincidence but I like to pretend they're always hooking me up.
author: Jessica F.

description: I've only recently moved to San Francisco, and I'm sick of overpriced organic gluten-free fair trade nonsense. Ironically, it took a trip to Haight-Ashbury to free me from the tyranny of burritos that think they're better than me. If you want straightforward old-fashioned Mexican food, with 2 excellent salsa choices at your table, head to the Red Zone. It's cash only, but they've got an ATM. Besides that, it's great lunch with neither fuss nor muss attached to it. Check it out.
author: Tony B.

description:
Zona Rosa is currently part of my Holy Trinity of Mexican food in San Francisco.  Located on the corner of Haight and Shrader, just a jaunt away from Amoeba Records and Golden Gate Park, Zona Rosa serves and delivers a fat plate of delicious food in comfortable quarters for a reasonable price.  And they're friendly, too!

From the outside, it may not look like much.  Cracked windows painted with the logos of our beloved Giants and Warriors; sidewalk sometimes strewn with cigarette butts and other strange left-behinds by the vagabonds of Haight Street, who wander and loiter about.  But once you are inside, you are greeted by warm and spacious accommodations: a mixture of tables, booths and counter seating that is rarely crowded and never filthy.

And trust me: if you are hungry and you enjoy straight-forward Mexican fare, then you, my friend, have stumbled into the right place.

You make your way to the service counter at the back of the dining room.  A large, easy to read menu is posted high above.  The counter is populated by steaming hotel pans of beans and meats neighboring all the necessary and delicious fixings, such as guacamole, pico de gallo, jalapenos, sour cream, you get the idea!

More likely than not, you will be bid welcome by the friendly workers who stand behind the counter and between you and your latest food coma.  I'm not sure if Zona Rosa is family owned and operated, but it sure freaking feels like it every time that I go in there.  And, if it is not, then it does raise some pressing concerns regarding child labor laws, as I've definitely been helped before by industrious and friendly kids behind the register ... 

In any case - nightmare scenario aside - just being there gives me that cozy family vibe that so many establishments try to replicate, and often poorly.  There's just no substitute for the real deal!

So, invariably someone will say hello and you will place your order.  The fare is simple: tacos, burritos, enchiladas, chile relleno, etc. I've only had the taco platter (tacos with rice and beans) and the Super Burritos (a nearly foot-long monster of a burrito complete with sour cream, salsa, and guac) and both were filling and excellent.  You and your server work your ways down the line, cafeteria-style, until you've got yourself a meal, for here or to go.  

You pay the kid behind the counter (cash only, but there's an atm right behind you, if you need one), get a complimentary side of chips, and then it's time to enjoy.

You won't be disappointed.  The food is hearty and delicious.  I always eat in-house, because I need about an hour after chowing-down to digest.  The fare is heavy and the portions are generous.  But, like I said, if you are hungry and a fan of cozy Mexican cuisine, then Zona Rosa is always a home-run.
author: Max T.

description: I feel like I have visited this place for three decades and the food as been reasonable in price for the quantity and quality. The service was kind and the food was amazing. Great to get a fast burrito and sit in the Golden Gate Park to eat it. Looking forward to my next trip.
author: Patty Caraballo M.

description: This place is so good and with the reasonable price can't beat it . Was gonna go to steet taco but this place was way better
author: Nina G.

description:
The best burritos in San Francisco ...

My family said ; are the best . ..

I'm agree 


Thank you   .
author: Angel F.

description:
Everyone is always arguing between El Farolito or La Taqueria, but my jam is Zona Rosa when it comes to burritos. Generous portions and no annoying long lines. Also free chips. The place gets a lot of warm sunlight (so different from el faro) and an inviting atmosphere. Nice escape from the hustle of Haight street. 

The super burrito (with guac) is $10 with tax. 

Very friendly staff. 

Only cash!
author: Lisa K.

description: This food tastes good. GOOD. I should know, I've probably eaten it 100 times. I love that they remember and recognize regulars. There are a lot of taquerias in SF, but I'd go to this one even if I didn't live around the block. Get the green salsa. Get it.
author: Christina G.

description: This restaurant has the best damn burritos in the city ! Better than el farolito on mission and on 24th , better than la corneta also on mission , better than the taqueria on 25th and mission ! Better than all them places !! I've gone there 3 consecutive days ! It's the best !!!
author: Vanwa T.

description: Best nachos ever had. They hook it up here with great toppings at a reasonable price.
author: Oscar E.

description:
Why on earth does Zona only have 3.5 stars on Yelp?! 

Zona- I'm here to help!

Zona Rosa is the only authentic Mexican food option in the Upper Haight. Forget yo "Street Taco", and come on down to Zona Rosa. Staff is always *super* friendly, and the quality of food is ALWAYS consistent and on point. I've been living in the neighborhood on and off for several years, and Zona Rosa has always been the BEST. 

Just keep in mind that they're cash only- but also well worth a trip to the ATM. ;)
author: Pamela ..

description: Got the regular tacos. They are quite large, and delicious. Two was plenty. Don't be surprised, its cash only though. Great food, fast service.
author: Karl J.

description: My dad used to work here when he lived in Sf, pretty sure it was his first job in America, he always used to tell me about this place, how he met Santana here and others. well twenty something years later I drove up from La to sf with with some friends for a music event, we were leaving amoeba and lo and behold I saw the zona rosa sign and thought of my pops, went it with my friends and yooooo, we all agreed that these were some of the best burritos we've ever had! The carne asada super burrito with guac . Not to mention the different choices for salsa. I seriously can't wait to come back soon! seriously one of the best burritos in the state.
author: Rene G.

description: Definitely won't come back here. First of all the prices are just some arbitrary number on the menu. I came here and ordered a California burrito advertised as $8.22. I was told that was without tax(super random number) the burrito was advertised to have beans, meat, cheese, rice,salsa and guacamole. My order was made without rice and I was told guac was extra. When it came to pay i asked the total because the register said $11.00 what type of math is this!? I said I didn't have enough cash and that I'd be forced to use their shady atm machine or cancel my order. At that time the cashiersaid ok $9.00 even -_-. I just paid the $9. The place only takes cash so they just make up any old number. I bet if they took credit/debit actually charging customers the right amount wouldn't be an issue. Street taco and taqueria are a short walk away. Those are much better options
author: Faith O.

description: Best burrito in the city if you ask me. Their ingredients are fresh and they take pride in the creation of your entree.
author: PK R.

description: They have the BEST carnitas, you never feel rushed, and it feels like you're visiting someone's home :)
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is good for a quick bite. I was hoping for a little more flavor. We got a plate of nachos with beef. We couldn't taste the beef. It was good, just not amazing. With so many food choices in SF, why settle. The price was great, and they have a small selection of beer. Maybe I just didn't get the right food item, but it didn't impress me.
author: Jen T.

description:
Still as good as ever!!  Been around for yrs...

Must stop here if your in the Area.  Or travel, it's worth it!

The burritos are incredible. Fluffy rice, choice of beans, and perfectly marinated meat to top it off.  

I prefer the grilled chicken, but the other chicken is good.  Salsas, green and red, both are good.

I only know the burritos I want to try something different but just too hard to pass up.

Also, super friendly service!
author: Mike M.

description:
Most underrated burrito place in SF. 
for its price, fantastic food, sauces, and ambient. 

I recommend shrimp burrito.
author: Jinn C.

description: Small, but delicious! We needed a quick bite while leisurely peregrinating through Haight-Ashbury.  This place is a funky and fun burrito shop with a nice variety. The staff behind the glass window at the counter takes your order as you walk down the counter. Hubby got a chicken burrito with black beans, brown rice and veggies. The girls shared a couple chicken tacos. They offer free salsa in squeeze bottles (green and red salsas). Whiffs of grilled carnitas and marijuana mingled in the air by the back kitchen, but hey, it's the Haight.
author: Danielle G.

description:
Stopped by with a good friend and got plates of takeout to bring home. I had the chile relleno and a chicken enchilada combo plate and she had a carnitas burrito. 

I loved the food. It was extremely flavorful and they give you plenty. The Chile Relleno was perfectly picante, just enough heat. I really enjoyed it.

The chicken in the enchilada was really nicely seasoned, not a bit bland. A+!

My friends burrito was  huge and she gave it 2 thumbs up.

I took off one star because there is no self serve salsa bar but given the activity on the street, maybe that's more better for them. Unfortunately the separate side of salsa I requested was not included in my order.

If you're eating in be prepared for LOUD music. I was very happy with my meal at home and would definitely go back to try some more specialities.

Not sure if they deliver out to the beach but if they do I'll def be trying that.
author: Sharon J.

description: This is my favorite burrito spot in the Haight! The family always welcomes me with a smile and a friendly attitude. Not to mention their portions are more than generous in comparison to the price. I am moving out of the neighborhood soon but, I will definitely pop in to satisfy my burrito fix from time to time. Highly recommended :)
author: Gianna B.

description: Da Supah Chicken Burrito was ono, brah! Buggah was wrapped tight in tin foil and when broke da mout cousin! Had 2 kine sauces on da tables, red & green  both was frickin' hoooot, but when burn so good, boo. Cheeeeee!
author: John F.

description: When I went to law school in SF back in 1997-2000, I always came here and thought they made the best burritos. I now live in LA and have not found a burrito as good as the ones here. La Burrita in Berkeley has burritos as good as this place. I hope the burritos here are as good as they were 2 decades ago. Glad to see this place is still in business.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
7/9/14- Stopped in with friends who rave about this place.  I had never actually eaten a burrito... I know, I know but I usually go w/ other options.  

I ordered the vegetarian burrito and asked for a smaller size as the wraps my friends got were crazy large.  I had whole beans, rice, pico or perhaps it was salsa, onions, mixed veggies, cilantro, & jalapenos.  I didn't take the chips that come w/ as this burrito was my focus and I wanted to finish the whole thing w/o filling up on chips. The burrito was delicious esp. w/ the addition of their CRAZY good hot sauce- the red one.  I didn't try the green sauce as I like it hot!  I washed it down w/ a diet coke or two- their fountain soda was mixed perfectly. 

Now... I docked 2 stars for the bathroom- it was filthy, had no paper towel and the soap was watered down and therefore useless in cleaning hands esp. those making food!!!!  This disgusts me b/c they only have one bathroom and this is the one the employees use so... 

Customer service was friendly and the burrito was good but that doesn't make up for the bathroom

Cash only
author: Kristi O.

description:
Decisions decisions.  Carnitas,  spicy chicken, spice pork, steak and more.  So many delicious looking choices!  Even the tofu vegi option looked tasty.
Ended up with a spicy chicken and pork mix. Delicious!
author: mark S.

description:
Was hoping to get better than average Mexican food here compared to the East, but it was just average- so was a bit disappointed-

Big servings though-
author: Susan K.

description:
I was definitely expecting a bit more from Zona Rosa. The guys behind the counter were friendly and speedy, and my carnitas burrito was hearty although leaning on the bland side.  I had to drown it in the hot sauce at the table (delicious hot sauce, mind you) to bring it to life.  The carnitas were average, and again a bit on the bland size.  

Oh, and dude making the burritos - Please wear gloves when you're making it... I didn't see you wash your hands the entire time I was there.  Just sayin'...
author: Andreas H.

description: I been here few time aNd the first time it was good food but very bad customer service then reading the reviews again I wanted to give it another chance. I went there and they just rushed thru taking my order very rude and this time the food was not as good as the fist time. I asked for veggie burrito and I got some chicken in it and it was dry. My friend asked for steak burrito and it was so creasy she couldn't finished. I wouldn't go their again sorry
author: May A.

description: Solid neighborhood taco and burrito place. Not amazing but perfectly good. The carnitas are the best protein option.
author: bill d.

description:
Been here twice!

Cheap and clean place for Haight street!

Get the chile verde burrito or make your own burrito
author: X M.

description: This place is small and the outside looks a little beat up, BUT don't let that stop you. This place is awesome. The tacos are huge she taste fantastic. Burritos are he size of a small baby. The only downside is they do t take credit cards. There is an ATM inside. But we need them to enter the 21st century and get a card reader. But so, so worth the trip.
author: Aaron N.

description:
Stopped in here on a whim, while exploring Height-Ashbury. 

I'm not a big burrito eater, but I humor my boyfriend every now and then. This place was pretty amazing to me. The two people behind the counter were super nice, even as I awkwardly ordered. 

I'm super impressed by how well the woman wrapped our burritos. It was honestly like a work of art. I got a regular, and was very happy with it. But they also offered vegetarian options, even with a vegan tortilla. They also give you some chips on the side, which I used to eat the burrito pieces that fell.

All of the food looked fresh, and the place was very clean. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick fix.
author: Rebecca S.

description: I really like the refried beans here and the carne asada.  Is it the best burrito ever?  No, but it's usually damn good and more than enough for the price.
author: Erik G.

description:
I've been going here for about eight years.  Surprised I hadn't reviewed it.  

When I moved to the neighborhood, a friend who used to live here, said it had the best burritos in the city.  In about 30 visits, I've never had a bad meal or trouble finding a seat, whether with friends or alone.  The bar stools along the windows are great for watching people go by on Haight.

First time I went, there was a line of Mexican construction workers.  I went with a Mexican friend who had worked construction.  He said that was the best indication that this was a great place, since those guys not only knew Mexican food, they also would be very selective about where they spent their money.  

Since then, it's been a personal favorite, one always enjoyed by various friends I've taken.  Usually get a burrito (super with cheese, guacamole, and sour cream, or Californian, which has cheese and no rice) and an agua fresca, which are notable for their natural taste and low sugar content, compared to every other place I've had agua fresca.  They also have a large selection of fountain and bottled drinks, including various Mexican beers and the usual Coke made with cane sugar.

Very nice people who work there. Same great folks have been there the past 8 yrs. I think it's family owned and most who work there are related.
author: Mark M.

description: Best darn Burrito in the history of mankind.  Just peel back the foil, and let the magic happen.  Worth driving across the country and up to The Haight for.
author: Desmond L.

description:
This is the closest restaurant to my house and I couldn't be happier about it. You can easily get two meals out of a $10 super burrito (not me though - I eat it all in one sitting because I'm not a quitter). Their salsa is pretty spicy too. Good on them for bringin' the heat. Also, the people that work here are nice and never seem to skimp on any ingredient, which is why I'm so inclined to post this review.

Bring cash...
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I was walking around and had a craving for some quick Mexican food. I stopped in Zona Rosa for some shrimp and chicken nachos. They were delicious and large enough to share with my friend. I had a bit of extra topping and the nice lady behind the counter kindly offered me a few extra chips to finish it off.

The only consideration is that the place is a bit modest and has a bit of a grungy feel (to be expected in the haight).
author: Marcus T.

description:
For a restaurant on Haight Street I was very pleased with the overall cleanliness and freshness of the ingredients. I enjoyed a rather generous sized, delicious chicken and guacamole burrito and shared some nachos with friends. All was going well until I spied a METAL SCREW covered in guacamole in the nachos----no kidding! One of the restaurant workers offered to make us a fresh plate of nachos, but seemed unsurprised, nor really concerned that we'd found such a peculiar, and potentially hazardous object in our food. He's lucky this restaurant avoided having to pay what I am sure would have been costly dental bills. 

Would I return here? Well, yes, he's also lucky the food here is good enough to bring me back for more in the future; I would have written a four star review, but the screw cost them a star.  Moral of the story, watch what you eat, literally!
author: Brennan H.

description: The fiancé and I had worked up an appetite hunting around at Amoeba and decided to give Zona Rosa a try.  Yeah...not the best decision we made that day.  We shared a carne asada burrito as we had dinner in a few hours.  The burrito was pretty unremarkable.  The steak was pretty tender but kind of lacking in overall flavor.  The overall burrito kind of just lacked a punch.  The saving grace was their sauces on the tables which were pretty good.  We ended up slathering a lot of sauce on the burrito to make it work.
author: Rob P.

description:
Eh.

Filling burritos and quesadillas, no doubt.

but no real WOW factor.  (definitely need to work on the salsa. cilantro and some variety with the peppers would help a lot)

still, if you are hungry and looking for something quick to go, this is a good place (if you can find parking)
author: Mike V.

description: Good staff, "authentic" environment. Cash Only tho... ATM inside. All in all really good food.
author: David B.

description:
Yummy carnitas and platter specials.  The menu is confusing at first, everyone who isn't familiar stands there reading for a while at first.  It's normal, the staff seams to understand and backs off.  

The food is super yummy and they will customize for you.  You tell them no sour cream and guess what, you don't get sour cream.  The burritos are not soupy and they're flavorful.  

Again the PORK is so damn good.  Don't miss the carnitas (pork) in any item them make.  Pork makes the world go around.  If taking out ask for the red or green sauce on the side, they have pre-filled cups or you can fill your own up.  Get lots of napkins too.
author: B K.

description:
So you're like: "Hmm.. I haven't had a serious food coma for a while. Maybe I can find a place that will make me feel like I ate a brick."

If that's you, then this place will do. 

I asked for the "Super Burrito" with "everything on it." They smiled, and punched me in the stomach with a burrito. Now I'm sleepy. 

Delicious. Large. Delargicious. Burrito craving satisfied.
author: Rob R.

description: I love this place! Their meats are sooo flavorful. The salsa is simply amazing!! I sometimes want to ask them how much it would be for me to buy a gallon of that stuff. I hate going into the city because of traffic, but I'd cross the bridge for this place.
author: Temmara S.

description: love this place. flavors are authentic, the carne con chile is amazing. the staff is super friendly. one of my favorites.
author: Ernest S.

description:
(4.5 stars)  Good food, nice people.  I've had a burrito here twice and they were both solid.  This isn't a Portlandia-type place, so don't expect artisanal, organic, or whatever else.  Just good, cheap Mexican food.

Nice anecdote: The first time I went I didn't have cash, only to realize it's cash only when I was ready to pay.  I went home to grab some $ (only had a credit card that I couldn't use in the ATM).  When I came back 15 minutes later the guy insisted on making me a fresh, warm burrito.  When I refused, he sold it to me for 5 bucks (I think they're like $8.50).  I really appreciated that.
author: Sam M.

description:
You know it's good when you can smell the peppers roasting in the morning - the main ingredient for their fiery red sauce! *my favorite

Then during the afternoon, you can smell the delicious aroma of meat grilling interspersed between the marijuana smoke the Upper Haight emanates.

It's always smiles when I come in, they always know how to take care of me with generous helpings of everything.  Everything is made in-house and that's what good Mexi-Cali food is all about.
author: Isa H.

description:
If you are always in the Haight as I am, and you are looking for a quick tasty meal Go to La Zona Rosa. Usually I get the Steak Quesadilla it is incredibly delicious and it feels me just right. I have tried the burritos as well and they are pretty good.
there are some other Mexican restaurants in the Haight but i feel like Zona Rosa is the best.
author: Johnny C.

description: Best food I ever had omg best ever  I ordered everything in the menu just to test it out and every plate I had was awesome. All the meats where so flavorful the guacamole was super good.
author: Javier C.

description: Walked in on a whim but I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was. Loved the chicken super burrito. Guacamole could have been thicker -- it had more of a salsa consistency that didn't do much for me. Thankfully, I got mine on the side instead of inside the tortilla. Other than that, great flavors and they have all your favorite Mexican beers and sodas.
author: Michael R.

description:
I'm originally from Los Angeles, so Mexican food is my favorite food. Lucky for me, Zona Rosa is two blocks away from where I live, so I am a frequent customer.

They are generous with how much meat they give, which is a HUGE plus. The service is also very fast.

Minus one star because the chips ALWAYS taste like burnt popcorn.
author: Kandace B.

description: This is the classic neighborhood Taco Shop. They have the menu items you expect. The food is always solid & reasonably priced. They know my order without saying a word. There's a TV for when sports are on. They're super nice.
author: Sean P.

description:
Some items are a hit or miss, but they keep me coming back for the super shrimp burrito. I ditch the sautéed bell peppers they add with it, but that's just me. Always a generous amount of shrimp that they cook right in front of you. It's a little pricey ($12? Also cash only) but it is always worth it. The California burrito is good option as well.

Service is quick and to the point. Grab a mexican coke or a tamarindo and you're good to go.
author: Katie S.

description:
Zona Rosa has yummy DIY Mexican food. Maybe it's what Chipotle aspires toward..
Their tacos are plentiful and delicious. The burritos are freaking huge as is the taco salad. I LOVE their guacamole, house salsas and especially the vegetable mixture; you can eat well as a vegetarian or carnivore here.
author: Rachel D.

description:
This place is in a colorful (read: seedy) area of haight ashbury.  Tons of people on the streets... very few tourist looking people... homeless people, drunk people, drunk  homeless people,  very alternative looking people... and loud.  The people we were with felt intimidated walking down the street because you literally had to walk THROUGH their groups or go into the street because they took up the whole sidewalk.  

We went to Zona Rosa BECAUSE of Yelp reviews... so thanks, Yelpers!
It was  affordable.  Beware - it is CASH ONLY.
It was clean.  It was pretty tasty.
The chips were stale, not good.  They did not provide salsa or anything.  
Hubs got a carnitas burrito for which he got to pick all the fillings.  I got cheese enchilada meal.  Enchiladas were made from scratch right then & there so had a slightly different - but good - feel.  The sauce was not my favorite, but decent.  The refried beans were good.  The rice was OK.
overall, for the price it was good.  I don't know that I would go out of my WAY to go here, but if I happened to be in the area, I would happily eat there again.
author: stacie M.

description: This place is DEFINITELY one of them! Zona Rosa is the most underrated, under-travelled burrito place in San Francisco. I highly reccomend their chile verde if you're in the mood for something a little different than the run of the mill carnitas of San Francisco. Worth passing by the homeless people to get to, so you know it's good!
author: Charles M.

description:
I'm a regular here and the it is perfect for your corner taqueria. I get take-out probably 3-5 times a month on a week-night when I don't feel like cooking.

The ambiance in there is lacking and the furniture etc is a little run down. As far as cleanliness though, the kitchen area is exposed and I feel that they have a lot of pride in keeping the place clean and keeping the food fresh. 

The customer service is great for a place that you wouldn't expect to have it. They will deliver your plates to your table and ask you if you need any sauces etc. 

The tall guy with the pony-tail is the best! My food always tastes better when he puts it together, I swear!
author: Kristen M.

description: Stopped in here because we were low on time and the Cuban place across the street had too long of a line.  We'd already eaten at the street taco place a block down so we decided to eat here.  First off they give you a ton of food.  It was good, but not distinctive. If the lines aren't long I'd highly recommend the place down the street, but otherwise you can't go wrong here.
author: Glen Y.

description:
Basic cheap mexican food. 
Pros:
----Quick service
Cons:
---iffy ingredients and flavors
---advertised prices on the board don't match actual pricing
---hey, we're in haight..some bums/vagabonds will bump in

If you can  I recommend finding another place!
author: Robert M.

description:
Our neighborhood burrito shop. When we visited Zona Rosa this week with out of town guests, one of the kids said, "Is this place like Chipotle?" Her parent replied, "This is what Chipotle wants to be." Well said! 

Always good, inexpensive, with hearty Mission-style portions! They have whole wheat tortillas, thick tortilla chips and Pacifico bottles, too - and the Giants game on TV. What more could you ask for on a week night in the Haight?
author: Susan L.

description:
Tamales = Yummy.

Customer Service = Consistently friendly.

Menu = Limited. (Allows them to focus on making things GOOD! And not just making things.)

Chips = Meh. 

Salsa bar = Invisible. 

TV = Hey, fix that HDTV.
author: Joel G.

description: Holy cow I got a burrito here in 1984 and every time I've come to San Francisco since! Unlike every other place, the burritos have NOT gotten smaller and are still delicious with fresh ingredients and so very affordable! LOVE this place!
author: Katie K.

description:
Solid burritos in a taqueria-starved location.

Zona Rosa might not beat the Mission's Mexican food (especially my personal fave, Pancho Villa), but it comes pretty damn close. I'm thankful for its existence in the Haight -- it's by far the best taqueria for miles around.

Get the grilled chicken super burrito with refried beans, cheese, guacamole and sour cream -- it's kinda perfect. My "healthy" alternative, the veggie burrito with black beans, isn't bad either.

Service is fast -- I've never had to wait in line for very long -- and you can be in and out the door with a takeout order in like 3 minutes. 

Love you, Zona Rosa. My only request? Install a salsa bar, please!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Been coming here for years.  Best place in the Haight for a quick bite, and the service is always friendly.

I'm a meat-eater, but my go-to is their veggie burrito.  Outstanding tortillas.
author: Doug H.

description:
Other than the weirdos loitering the streets, Haight St. has just about everything that one's need; only if the panhandlers don't get extremely agressive and do something absurd.

I was shopping for a gift for a friend's birthday party and walking the busy and filthy Haight St.-strip can build up an appetite. So what food replenishes my lost of energy? 

To regain my energy, this corner taqueria has a dark ambience to fit the identical image of most of Haight St. businesses.  

From the menu, the taqueria have only three different meats; Carne Asada (Grilled Steak), Carnitas (Grilled Pork), and Chicken (cooked and grilled). They also have a Vegeterian option, in which I got for my lunch. Though pricey for $7.50, the vegetables comprised with chopped Mushrooms, Bell-Peppers, Onion, Carrots, and Zucchini. And those veggies were grilled before landing on a large flour tortilla filled with sour cream, avocado, cheese, rice and choice of beans and Salsas (hot or mild). Even without the meat, the "so-called" vegetarian burrito was very tasty and filling and is a very nice size, in lengyh and weight. The condiments were very fresh and the cheese was very sharp tastewise. I also got a refreshing bottle of Mandarin-flavor Jarritos for $2.00.  I enjoyed my meal at the dining area and watching Sunday NFL games on the two big Flat-screen TV.

This taqueria only accepts cash, but they have a ATM machine inside with a fee charge. There is also no beer or any alcoholic beverage serve here. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3236WheGABGCs6hdshWnjA?select=Ar4fR746_Sq12Jplaaxueg
author: Matt G.

description:
THANK YOU!

Not only do they have great street tacos but the customer service is so nice!  An hour after we finished eating I noticed that I was missing my  friendship bracelet that a new had given me in Half Moon Bay.  I needed that bracelet back!  To my surprise it was still at Zona Rosa's!  Seriously, if you have been to Haight Ashbury lately it is nothing less than a miracle!
author: Affinity Z.

description: I would have liked to rate this higher but can't. We got chile rellanos, tamales and enchiladas. The enchiladas and refried beans are great, totally delish. The tamale was meh. The rellanos just awful. Awful. They tasted like freezer. Just yucky. So sad. :(. I bet the tacos and burritos are fantastic, but we didn't have them. :(
author: Summer S.

description:
Rossa vs. Rosa.

Rossa was epic. Life affirming. Priceless. http://youtu.be/AfJUlXPTnus

Rosa was good. Stomach filling. Priced high.

Could eat three grilled chicken Rosas after experiencing one A&B Rossa.

Rossa deserves (at least) five stars. Rosa earns three.
author: Jason B.

description: Not bad, not amazing. Minus one star because there is too much cilantro in their guac and the tortilla to filling ratio was off...I'm really not about chewing hella tortilla  all in my mouth at once. Minus another star because they skimped on my cheese and I had to ask for extra. Nice aesthetics though, kind employees..I think what threw me off was that when I walked in I said it was my first time and didn't know what to get and this customer next to me said "EVERYTHING IS SOOO GOOD!" Had me thinking I'd just discovered some special neighborhood gem of a taqueria. So I got something basic, and it was...basic. I'll definitely go back though, and try something more exciting next time :)
author: Elana J.

description:
Best Burritos in the city nobody has Mexican food like ZONA ROSA!!!


Chile chicken verde is  a must  try and don't forget the carnitas there awesome.
There refried beans and rice are so good. 

Customer service is great!! the cool guy with the tattoos is so friendly and he also makes the best burritos.

Check them out when your on height street a must stop in.


GO DONS!!!
author: Jessica M.

description: Wicked good for lunch with plenty of vegetarian and gluten free options.  Tried Rosie's Nachos and got a big ol' plate for $9.  Your choice of black beans or refried beans plus cheese, guac, sour cream and pico.  Meat lovers can add beef or chicken for a couple dollars more.
author: Leslie H.

description:
I expected more considering it is in  San Fransisco .
We had  a couple of super burritos. I plan and  pick our restaurants
based on what neighborhood we are in. Since we were in Haight Ashbury
we  picked Zona Rosa. It was pretty good just not
great and it was also huge. If you are in the area it is good I
wouldn't skip it but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there either.
author: Pinky And The B.

description:
Limited. Just burritos and tacos. No salads, no flexibility.

That's cool, it's a small taqueria. However, the prices are a lot of a hole in the wall. How can a simple burrito (chicken, rice, beans....that's it) cost more than $5? Yah, try $8. Eh.

Oh, and cash only.
author: Amy O.

description: I live around the corner and eat here 1-3 times per week for the past year. Quick, ez, and good food with large portions. These people are super kind and remember my preferences.
author: Kenneth J.

description:
I decided to walk the extra block from El Balazo today and was pleasantly surprised of what Zona Rosa had to offer.  The California burrito packed plenty of punch and was $7.50 after tax.  The menu is not nearly as extensive, but when you're in the Haight you just want to keep it simple anyway.  

I'll be back.
author: John H.

description: 8 dollar amazing meal. Tamales (homemade) and beans and a drink. Got to tip them as well. Money well spent
author: Christian L.

description: A decent lunch staple for when I used to work on Haight Street. I like to get two veggie soft tacos. A good amount of food for ~$7. Plus their crispy chips & Chipotle hot sauce are delicious . Cash only.
author: Christian M.

description: Delicious and near Amoeba!  Affordable too, one of my favorite spots in SF for Mexican.
author: Dave M.

description:
I was working at the Buffalo Exchange on Haight and during my lunch decided to give Zona Rosa a go. I'm Hispanic, and when I'm really hungry, I'm going to lean towards some Mexican food. 

I decided to try the California Burrito. I didn't want to much of a fuss so I kept it simple. Steak, refrained beans, rice, guacamole and some salsa.  The burrito was very tasty, but it wasn't anything that made my mouth water, hence the 3 star review. It was just okay for me. When something simple, like the burrito I ordered, isn't perfect, it's hard to be completely satisfied.  

However, it wasn't awful and I would come back to try one of their other meal options.

I do wish they would serve more chips with their dishes.  They seemed like an after thought.
author: Jonathan R.

description: This place has amazing nachos, they pile their homemade-ish chips high with all of the goods! Only problem is, is that they are slightly spendy, on the $12 a pop side for the super nachos and cash only.  I however, have been here twice and will be back again to get a burrito. They look super tasty. Also, their carnitas is on point, my litmus test for a good Mexican place.
author: Ezra B.

description: Salty, salty, salty! Please use less salt in the beans.  Food wasn't hot enough in temperature for a cold day.
author: Lou F.

description: Among the best burritos in the city!  Fresh ingredients & generous portions are some of the reasons why. Salsa is amazing too.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Sometimes I like to treat myself to what I like to call, "Death by Carbs" - aka: a nice meat burrito with lots of rice. I'm a NorCal gal so the fact that there is a beyond-healthy serving of rice in my burritos is a great comfort to me the same way that a huge slab of ribs with a pint-full of mashed potatoes might be for someone else. 

Zona Rosa's regular carne asada burrito becomes my option of choice in these times of need. At almost $7 that puppy lasts me about two meals. I get a fair amount of tasty carne asada and at least a few day's worth of carbohydrates in rice.... just the way I like. The glass-bottle Coke serves as a nice high-caloric complement.
author: Loli L.

description:
After a night of celebration with eL Capitan in the Bay Area, Stella and me awaken on the SF side of the bridge and of course, since we find ourselves once again in SF,  we have to visit Zona Rosa. 
This morning it is the one familiar place where all the workers are really friendly and why the hell did we not make it back to Berkeley? Oh, yeah, drinking and driving don't mix, so says Stella as she remembers what I cannot. 
The food at Zona Rosa, of course, is always very good and tastes fresh every time.
They take very good care of hungover patrons with super burritos and carne asada tacos. I never have a complaint when I'm here but I never remember how I ended up in the Haight and where the hell are Stella, Maria, Eddly and eL Capitan???
author: Dave S.

description: Love the spicy beef burrito. Been coming here for soooo long (10 or so years) just remember cash or use the atm inside.
author: Kristan B.

description:
While I do LOVE their burrito, their menu is set up all funky, so you either end up without cheese or meat or rice and beans... 

It makes me a little crazy. I look forward to it every time, so please please please don't make me think so hard when I get there. 

Cheese is totally necessary on a dam burrito, ( I don't spell curse words correctly because I am big on not having a potty mouth) B-tards. 

Be careful if you sit at one of the counters. They look safe until you turn around to fetch some napkins and realize you are on a ledge. Our son took a flying leap into the trash can.

So, If you want a good burrito on the haight... here it is.
author: lucy b.

description:
Zona Rosa is one of my food havens on Haight, and not just because it's on the cheaper side (though that doesn't hurt). There's enough seating, all the counter people are nice, and it's pretty clean.

I've only ever gotten a super packed, cheesy, beautiful chicken quesadilla here, but I can tell you that it's totally worth every penny. It's really big, for one thing, and it's got enough variety that you don't feel like you're just eating a cheese quesadilla with some chicken thrown in. The guacamole is good, as are the chips. It's a nice package.

I'm pretty sure they don't take cards, so bring cash and an empty stomach.
author: Jiordan C.

description: Zona Rosa's carnitas super burrito with everything and lots of salsa verde is one of my favorite meals in SF. A must-try for burrito connoisseurs!
author: Molly P.

description: Zona Rosa is amazing!!!! The best Mexican food in the area. The staff is so friendly, the kitchen looks super clean, the food is always SO good, and its affordable! They even fry the crispy taco shells when you order it. Everyone raves about the burritos, but I'm a fan of their plates. You can get a taco/enchilada/tamale with another option, and it's so good. The chips are even amazing. 5/5, would recommend. Thank you Zona Rosa for the delicious food!!!
author: Katie R.

description:
Best in the city!
In a city that some say invented the dry burrito, this is the best I've had.  I used to come here in college and I loved it then... I was back 10 years later with my daughter and it was just as good as I remember it.  Stuffed with goodness, if you want a great burrito, this is the only place to do it up!
author: David E.

description: "Regular " sized burrito was more than enough food. One of the more affordable dining options on Haight street. Ingredients looked a little bland on the prep buffet (when compared to chipotle), but myChicken burrito had way more flavor than expected. The marinade on the chicken was more oily than spicy--a nice change of paste. Definitely recommend it if your looking for a reasonably priced quick bite. Just don't eat too much food.
author: Jake W.

description: We recently moved to NOPA and needed a walking distance Mexican choice. Zonal Rosa hit spot and did a good job. Shrimp for shrimp burrito is grilled while you wait which isn't very long because they are efficient and put the rest of the fixin's together while it grills. The flavors were good, staff friendly and the hot sauce is flavorful and hot. We'll be going back and already told two people to go there.
author: Christopher K.

description: My kids love eating the burritos here...we come a bit often so they have remembered how my kids like their burritos lol The workers are very nice and friendly here and they have fresh ingredients. Oh yeah cash only..but they do have an atm or wells fargo across street.
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Great food at a great price. We both got cheese quesadillas. Lots of cheese and cooked perfectly. I was a lil bummed that there were no salsas to choose from like most taquerias. Only bottled hot sauce. The pico de gallo was really good. 

The employees were nice. Very fast service. Cheap food, I think my total was $3 for a good sized and very cheesy quesadilla. 

I will return next time I'm in the Haight and would recommend everyone to stop in if they're in the area.
author: Setareh A.

description:
I come here often enough that the guys don't even really ask what I want anymore, they just make it.

Spicy steak super burrito is fantastic. When I stray from that, the vegetable burrito and the quesadilla with pollo verde are excellent alternatives.

The only thing questionable are the chips, which are free, but just not good. I still eat them when hungry though.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I love this place

the food is delicious, the staff is super nice. I only wish they were open later.  They have amazing chicharones.
author: Bird E.

description: This place knows how to make some delish burritos.  Would give it 5 stars, but the cash only part gets frustrating sometimes...
author: Sean S.

description: I had been wanting to check out this little place for months, and I finally stopped inside on a very warm, beautiful late Saturday afternoon in September. The food was delicious. I ordered a two-item combo meal -- a steak taco and chicken enchilada -- and for $9.50, given that it included rice, beans, and all the fixins, I was in heaven. I walked in, ordered, and the very friendly guy at the register said he would bring it to me when it was ready. The atmosphere was also super chill -- a nice alternative to the craziness that is Haight Street. Granted, I was there at 4:45 PM on a Saturday, so that might have had something to do with it being fairly quiet. But definitely a great taqueria, with nice big front windows for people watching along Haight Street. Cash only, FYI.
author: Zach M.

description:
solid mex food. 

i had dinner plans on this particular day, and while out an about i got hungry around 3:30 or so. i was really craving one or two flavorful street tacos, and ended up at zona rosa. 

i ordered two regular tacos - one carnitas and one chicken. word to the wise - they do not sell street tacos (you know, the teeny tiny ones). these tacos were HUGE. i was actually pretty mad at myself for ordering two. 

BUT they were pretty delish. especially the carnitas one. and I really LOVE the hot red sauce they use - yummy!!! will definitely be back if i find myself in the haight with a craving (albeit i'll order only one taco).
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Cheep, Fast and Good !

The nachos are good and filling.
Tacos are on the large size. 
Rice is always cooked just right.
Green salsa is tasty.
Service is friendly.

What more could you ask for.
author: Simon The Cat -.

description: I hate to sound like "one of those people" but Zona Rosa used to be so much better. Got a super chicken yesterday and the rice was bland, the chicken tasteless, the salsa too salty and they were out of whole wheat or spinach tortillas. They used to have awesome chips - now they are costco bul special.  But what really bummed me out was the wrap. Zona used to have the best, tightest, most evenly distributed wrap in the business. Yesterday was a joke. The jalapenos were clustered on one end, the chicken on another and some mush in between. And it was loose like a Chipotle wrap in De Moines. No offense to Des Moines intended. Where did you go Zona of old?
author: jason s.

description: NACHOS! So good. Meal for 2 people. YUM!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Carne Asada burrito. Meh.

I can make a better burrito at home with my eyes closed. Oh well, try once and move on. Way better Mexican options in the city
author: Rouz E.

description:
I told the guy i wanted a regular burrito. he put the chicken (what little of it) and bean on it and passed it to the woman, who asked "everything on it". I said yes and she put sour cream, lettuce onion and guacamole on it (in retrospect the guacamole should have sent a signal). Then the cashier said 9usd. I was like wow isnt it 6usd something. He said everything meant SUPER burrito. I told him I didnt know that. He was like "Eh" and gave me the "pay up bitch" look. So I had to pay 9usd for a burrito that didnt taste that good.
I told my friend about it and he said that is normal practice for any Mexican joint and I should get over it!!! Is that true? Am I in the wrong here?
author: dat n.

description: A bit pricey, especially for burritos in SF. But hey, it's the Haight, so everything is more expensive in the touristy locations of the City. Best taqueria in the Haight (granted there's only two.. Lol) and REALLY GOOD carnitas.
author: Eduardo R.

description: In terms of the quality ingredients and taste of your burrito, this place completes with the best of the mission. It feels a little gimmicky being in the touristy area of the Haight but that's the only negative. Highly recommend.
author: Chad U.

description: This place is the real deal. Huge mission style burritos, nachos to die for and tacos that are a real deal. The workers are so friendly and nice. I live in the haight and always come here when I crave good Mexican taqueria food!!!!
author: La H.

description:
Pros: My taco tasted okay.

Cons: I got food poisoning after eating it, and have not been able to stop throwing up since. It has been close to 24 hours of stomach pain, thanks to Zona Rosa. 

I will say my girlfriend had the vegetarian burrito and was fine. I had a chicken taco and feel like I might have to go to a hospital if it doesn't stop hurting.
author: Megan L.

description:
Zona Rosa looks fantastic. It certainly fits the part of a taqueria from the street. 

Unfortunately the food isn't very good -- though it is expensive. 

$7.50 for a pollo asado burrito with guacamole. Would you be willing to pay that? I certainly would, if the burrito was good. 

I give it one star for the food, and add the other star on because it looks so good from the outside... which is probably the best place to experience it.
author: Horace A.

description:
Let me just say that there are a lot of good taquerias in this town. Zona Rosa is not one of them.

I had a taco which was fine, but too bad the guac was terrible. Absolutely no flavor. In fact, I could taste the tomatoes more than the avocados--not a good sign. 

What would have been a 2 and a half star visit, turned into a 1 when two hours later, sick to my stomach I was vomiting in my bathroom. And no, I had no alcohol that day. 

Bottom of the line, any meal that brings you to your knees puking deserves no more than one star--even if it was great. And Zona Rosa was by no means great.
author: Jeff C.

description: While i'm eating this tasty, affordable, and satisfying burrito I thought to myself for a second maybe this is a sign that God really loves us. Then I thought about the starving kids elsewhere in the world and said never mind, but maybe more appreciative of the simple pleasures in life.
author: Charles Z.

description:
When I had first moved to the Haight, years ago; Zona R was right around the corner.  I ordered a Super Veggie and could barely finish half of it.

Order the Super Veggie.  It rivals some other taquerias chicken and carne asada burritos.  It's THAT good.

And if you can't finish it, you're a whimp.  Just wrap up the rest of it in it's foil and take it home with your tail between your legs.

; )
author: Marcos R.

description: Great old standby.  In my top 5 Mexican joints in SF
author: Christopher F.

description:
AAAhhhhh the good old Haight, where many things are just fine and not particularly great.

Zona Rosa fits the bill.  I was hungry from a day of running around and attempting to order my life as best as one can when being apartmentless and I was particularly in the mood for a burrito.  This place was the closest and did the job just fine.

Super burrito was a decent size for $9 though I found it to be just average in taste.  The chicken didn't really stand out and for paying the money to make it "super" they sure skimped on the guacamole (not to mention that it looked very far from the consistency of a good hearty guacamole).

Again, overall it was just average.  If you're hungry and don't want BS coffeehouse food from Cole Valley, don't want a greasy piece of Haight Street pizza and don't have time to sit down for a meal, this is a good place to come.  It can't touch most of what is to be had in the Mission.
author: Steven R.

description: Zona Rosa serves reasonably priced and relatively authentic Mexican food.  The chicken burrito was fairly standard (though somewhat salty) and the shrimp burrito, featuring shrimp sautéed in a creamy sauce, was more unique.  Both were good, but not outstanding.  Though we got takeout, I noticed the interior was tidy and clean, and seems kid-friendly.  Food is served quickly, but one drawback here is that they only accept cash.
author: Chris T.

description: My favorite place to grab a burrito in SF.  I stop there every time I am in the city. Cash only tho.
author: Kevin P.

description:
One of my favorite mexican/burrito restaurants in SF. 

I like that when I order the carnitas, they put it on the grill for a minute to bring out the full flavor. They are happy to customize a burrito, I usually have no rice, no sour cream and jalapenos. I always ask for both the red and the green salsa when I get it to go, as the salsas are very tasty and nicely hot which I like. Go easy with them if you only like a little heat - the red is the hottest.

I have also had suizas here and they were done well, they do them all on the grill right in front of you. Only 4 stars because I agree with the comments about the cleanliness of the seating area. I almost never eat here and considering the large amount of students and transients they serve, it must be hard to keep up. But I don't come here for the atmosphere, I would rather take it to the park and eat it anyway.
author: John K.

description: this place is like Roberto's or Alberto's meets Subway. I had the privilege of eating here this past week on a business trip in Nor Cal. cute small family run taco shop where they make everything in front of you. Fresh product and all the ingredients  are cooked to perfection. Good sized burritos and cheap price wise, WARNING-CASH ONLY. but they do have an ATM on the property. great location near lots of shops and boutiques
author: Jacob H.

description: Pretty good Mexican food. The vegetarian burrito was good, filling, classic ingredients. Just not amazing. Great service, cash only!
author: Whitney K.

description: I first ate here in around 1992. I always come back. I crave their burritos. And they are a real value, one can feed you for lunch and dinner, if you want...if you can delay your gratification and addiction. Yum! I wish I had one right now....
author: J T.

description:
The best tacos so far in the City!
Cheap, fast, delicious, nice Mexican music, great location. I love it!

I can't wait the next taco at Zona Rosa: you'll meet me there!
author: Luca D.

description:
Pretty cold out today and I needed some sort of heat to warm me up. So I thought of something spicy for lunch. I haven't been here in a while so why not. 

I got the California Burrito - Steak, Rice, Re-fried Beans, Cheese, Sour Cream, Salsa, Chile Verde Sauce, Cilantro and lots of Jalapenos. Delicious! 

As usual the quality and taste of Zona Rosa's burrito always consistently dam good...
author: Gary E.

description: I've been coming here a lot more often since El Balazo closed for renovations. Its a good burrito. Not spectacular, but not bad either. It definitely hits the spot when I'm in the mood. The staff are fantastic and always very friendly.
author: Andie D.

description: This place is so amazing. It is authentic Mexican food that is super delish for a extremely reasonable price. I am in town for the week and I have now visited this place two w I would highly recommend this place to my friends my family the stranger on the street. It is so good I fully support people continue eating here and keeping them open. On top of everything the staff are so kind it is a wonderful place
author: Leah B.

description:
When I was in college at uc bezerkley, Zona Rosa on Telegraph was my all-time favorite burrito place...Sadly that location eventually closed and was replaced by Naan-n-Curry.

The good news is that I live in SF now and there's a ZR right here on Haight Street.  I know there are people out there that feel they have to drag themselves down to the Mission to get an authentic burrito...trust me, you don't.  Just go to ZR and get yourself a Chicken or Carnitas Super Burrito if you're a carnivore...or a Grilled Vegetable Super Burrito (my personal fav!) if u don't like harming animals while u chow down.  Horchata and complimentary chips here are really good 2.

Zona Rosa...checkity-check it out b4 u wreck yo' self...
author: Justin L.

description:
The best taqueria in the Haight, even though that's not really saying much. While it's not on the same level as some of the Mission's better offerings, Zona Rosa is where to go if you really need a burrito before your horrible guilty pleasure reality show starts in 10 minutes. At least I imagine that's where you'd go, I've never been in that situation. Honest.

It's cash only, so hit up an ATM before you come by.
author: Mark A.

description:
Congratulations, tattooed blue hair cap wearing man!  You've just lost a customer who spent a good amount of change in this restaurant for the last 12 years!

Nachos for $10.96 should actually cover the bottom of the container AND contain cheese.  I know - news flash, but it is true.  A pint of beans should be, you know, A PINT.  Not three spoonfuls and squish the lid down tight to make it look like you've filled it up.  I feel completely ripped off and I won't be back which truly saddens me.

I always had a good serving from the blonde lady with the long ponytail...but this is completely and utterly crap.
author: Goddess B.

description:
Yuck! Skip it and walk the extra two blocks to El Balazo. 

Gross, unauthentic, and overpriced.
author: Halley B.

description:
Went in thinking it would be the best burrito on the Haight based soley on atmosphere and the fact that it seemed less commercial. Boy was I wrong! While the cashier was super friendly, the guy making my burrito was an ass and got mad at me because he misunderstood my order and remade it extra crappy.

That said, my girlfriend got hers made first and even hers was bland. We got the guac, cheese, sour cream, everything that should make a burrito bien rico. 

And for the record, this review is based soley on taste. I get that the guy probably was having a bad day. We all do. Can't fault the place for that...but the bland burrito is unforgivable.
author: Greg G.

description:
Incredible tacos, fresh ingredients and as other reviewers mentioned, extremely friendly service!
I ordered 1 taco, came with chips and it was more than enough. The few chips I did have were mediocre but the taco was so incredible I didn't care.
It's a great place to fill up and people watch on Haight St.
author: Annie P.

description:
Zona Rosa deserves better than this three and a half stars. The burritos are pretty good and a nice size too. My only argument here is there kinda expensive, but they taste good enough to still keep me coming back for more. I always get carne asada, got the carnitas once and wasn't to great and I don't really care for the pollo.

They had for a limited time  a carne asada that seemed like it was marinated in hot sauce (iI'm no cook so I dunno what they really did) anyways that was by far the best burrito I ever had. It's not like you get the hot sauce with your meat, this had an unbelieved flavor to it. If your lucky enough to be there and they have it again get it!
author: Josh E.

description: Love this place! The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food received. Both burritos and tacos are delicious and the staff are friendly. I usually go at least once a week.
author: Ashley R.

description: This is my go to burrito place. The people who work there are always smiling and they make good food. Cash only, (there's an ATM inside). I encourage you to go on in, sit by the window, and watch the people of Haight Street do their thing while enjoying affordable, delicious Mexican food.
author: Nadine O.

description:
3.5 stars

So we were uncertain about this place.  It looked empty and didn't seem as "authentic" as El Balazo down the block.  We decided to to give it a try and ordered a regular taco with beef.  To my surprise, she asked if I wanted refried or whole beans - refried please.  Next was regular or spicy beef?  Spicy please.  We opted with the regular so it was topped with a generous scoop of salsa.  Do we want some chips?  Sure, a few pieces are plenty.  

The tortilla was much bigger than other taquerias and it was piled with a lot of the spicy beef.  For $2.99 - it is a fantastic value.  It's not just a great value but also very tasty.  We took 2 chairs looking out onto the street and enjoyed our mini meal - scooped up the salsa, meat and refried beans with the chips squirting an absurd amount of hot sauce on top.  After we leveled the mountain of beef, we split the rest onto the 2 tortilla and enjoyed it.  The horchata was pretty good - they didn't fill the cup with ice like most places so you get almost a full cup of horchata.  

If we are ever in the neighborhood, we'll definitely be returning here for another large tasty taco but this time with the works - guacamole, cheese...etc.
author: Gloria H.

description: Decent burrito. Agua Fresca is great.
author: Chris H.

description: Burritos taste good, but I stopped eating here for a couple months. Then one day I decided to try it again. I've been ordering the same thing for over a year, but this time it made me sick and dizzy and I had to leave work early due to being unable to function. I think you need to build up a tolerance to the massive amount of MSG and grease to be able to eat here without getting sick. One burrito can last you 2 meals if you don't eat very large meals.
author: Jack C.

description:
If you can deal with the madness that is gutter punk central haight street and you do not mind eating an average burrito that will most likely not make you have the shits, while being watched from outside the window by a street person with dirt nap dreadlocks and urine on their pants, Zona Rosa is ok I suppose.

The burritos are basic. The service is basic. In and out....Eat your food and leave.
author: Go Cat Go G.

description:
Walk through the door and presto!  You're in Tijuana! 

Or something like it.  Maybe Mexico City, or Mazatlan, or Gilroy, or Mountain View.  I do know this:  the AM radio blasting ranchero music made me look around for an F-150 parked in the front yard.  Oh, right.  It was Haight Street, and there was no front yard.  

The steak burrito was as big as my forearm!  I am not kidding you, order one for yourself if you don't believe me.  That, a steak taco, a side of guacamole, bottled water and a fountain Coke, cost just under $16.  

Outside, a guy was eating and drinking leftovers from a trash can.  Where were we, again?
author: David D.

description:
When I spend 6.50 (including tax) on a vegetarian burrito I expect something special, something magical, something that defines my day and leaves me going to sleep thinking "Yes, yes, today was good." 

But when they just glop on the fixings, not even bothering to evenly distribute them across the tortilla, such is not the conclusion of my day.  No, instead I must spend a restless night feebly attempting to reign in my spiraling depression. 

Zona Rosa, you sir, suck.
author: jack p.

description:
Cheap, tasty, fast taco/burrito perfection. 

Their serving sizes are huge.  Burritos can only be finished in one sitting if you have been fasting for 3 days. My standard order is just one taco.  And they add enough toppings on that one taco to equal two normal sized tacos.  I fear what it would look like if I ordered two tacos.  I might still be at the taqueria trying to figure out how to carry my meal home. 

Their guacamole in your burrito or taco is good.  On its own as a dip is lacking.  Too saucy.  Their chips are good and fresh. 

Also I am always served by the same three-four people who are very nice and I think that alone says a lot about small taquerias.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Zona Rosa gets a bad rap. It seems like everyone who complains about it used to live in the Mission. That's right--it's not a Mission taqueria. Instead of hipsters, you'll be avoiding pierced teenagers from Marin who like to sit on the sidewalk and pretend they're homeless. But it's worth coming to. The ingredients are good; they make the burritos fast, and they stay together very well.

If you're already in the Haight and feel like a burrito, check this place out. If you want the best burrito, go to the Mission.

UPDATE:  6/4/09
=============

So I'm going to knock Zona Rosa down to three stars because the burritos aren't all that.  They're not all that bad, but the quality has gotten progressively worse, or I've just eaten here a lot more than I had when I wrote my initial review.
author: John S.

description:
Zona Rosa is a vile temptress - a wailing siren who beckons me toward the craggy rocks of myocardial infarction.  I consider myself a fit guy, but I would probably be an Olympian if it weren't for the nutritional Molotov Cocktail she tosses into my stomach so frequently.  

So often I tell myself, "no burrito today."  But then the neighborhood grows quiet, and on the wind I hear her calling.  So I cave a little and I say, "Just a California burrito.  No sour cream or guacamole" and before my mouth has completely formed the words, I'm out the front door with a ten in my hand.

As I near her glassy facade and begin to smell her intoxicating aroma, I resign little further.  "Guacamole - that's the GOOD kind of fat," I lie to myself and step inside.  Behind the counter, the mistresses that do m'lady's bidding convince me to give in completely.  "What kind of beans!?" they demand and I'm done for.

Zona Rosa is short on flair.  She doesn't take credit cards, isn't overly friendly and her decor centers on a moderately-sized TV showing some distant soccer game.  But then again, what Mexican Restaurant worth her Anchos would waste her time with flair?  It's the food, stupid.

And her food is phenomenal.  I have yet to find a better burrito in San Francisco.  Her tacos - soft and hard-shell - are just as impressive (if not more so, given the way they're overstuffed with wonderment).  And while cheese enchiladas, as a rule, are further down my "Lost on a Desert Island" list, those at Zona Rosa should pack their bags....

The lack of Margaritas would be a strike against it, were it not the one thing preventing me from becoming completely addicted to this place.  Sing your song, oh Lady Siren.  It is music to my ears.
author: Richard T.

description:
3.5 stars.  

After an awesome concert at Amoeba (Vampire Weekend!), Kevin L. and I were starving and looking for a quick fix.  Zona Rosa fit the bill.  

For the quality of the food, this place was kind of expensive.  I had the Nachos Con Carne, a plate filled with chips and covered with beans, cheese, guacamole, and steak.  It was huge and yummy, but the chunks of meat were pretty small and disappointing and the chips weren't quite as fresh and greasy as I like them.  

Kev stuck with his usual Carnitas Super Burrito.  The best part of this burrito was the fact that they took huge grilled pieces of pork and pulled the meat apart right in front of us.  Very fresh.  The meat was so tender and flavorful, unfortunately the tortilla wasn't that great, it kinda fell apart mid-burrito.

It was a good thing we had so much to eat for dinner, because it ended up taking us about 15 hours to get home...who knew you could take the 71 bus back to BART?  Muni riders are crazy (I'm talking about you Evan L.) but really, we thought there was a dog on the bus, but no, some old dude in the back just kept barking...then we smelled something burning and the fool had decided to light up a CIGAR!  What?

Note:  Yelling "Open Sesame" will not make the back doors to the bus open.

If you are in need of some quick Mexican food while in the Haight, this place is tasty, but pretty much just your average burrito joint.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I've been eating Zona Rosa burritos for 8 years now. The tamales and chili rellenos are also excellent. You can find cheaper food but here they give you a nice portion. The Super burritos will fill you up for sure. 
Stop by and check them out next time you in the upper Haight.
author: Kfir L.

description:
I really like this place for very basic reasons.It's clean, the people that work there are nice, the people that work there are nice and they actually have healthy things to eat on the menu. Their burritos are also REALLY good.

One thing I hate about burritos at most places is that they are either waaaayyyyy to big, or they are too small. This place serves burritos that are just the right size, and they don't overuse any of the ingredients. If there is one thing I can't stand is when burritos have too much filling inside  and it starts falling apart in your hand. I hate it when that happens... especially when it breaks at the bottom and al of a sudden oil and miscellaneous burrito liquid starts running down your hand and arms- YUCK. So yeah, you don't have to worry about that here. Other good things I can say about this place is that they have a really good vegetarian burrito and great guacamole. That is all I have tried here so far but everything else they serve looks appetizing. They have vegetarian tamales too, which is probably what I will get next time I go there.
author: Daniela A.

description:
ZR was my first SF burrito but after having tried tons of other places in the last 4 years, I have to say that this place falls really, really short. Expensive and kind of tasteless. A big burrito doesn't necesarilly mean it's going to taste any good. If a burrito is what you crave, I highly recommend hopping on the 33 and getting off at 16th and Valencia.

I'm going to upgrade ZR to 3 stars because what I have found is that their burritos don't suck, it's the meat. A veggie burrito (which only comes in super, not regular) is not only the most affordable on the menu, but is also really tasty. I recommend popping it in the oven for a few minutes or asking them to grill it a bit longer so all the cheese melts. Finally, a reason to come here! 

It's worth noting that in the year and a half I lived directly across the street, I visited Zona Rosa about 5 times. And I am very lazy.
author: Maria D.

description:
This is a 3.5 star rating. I couldn't give them a 3 because they try so hard, but they don't deserve a 4 either because their mole sauce is bad. I had the veggie tamale and they poured the mole sauce all over it and it was ruined. The sauce was bitter and unappetizing. 

Other than that, I recommend this taqueria. It's pretty authentic, good beans, good rice, good salsa and good service. There are hardly any taquerias that offer veggie tamales so kudos to Zona Rosa. The ladies behind the counter were attentive and courteous and friendly too! I would definitely eat there again at some point. I just wish they had fish tacos!
author: L. L.

description: This is my new go to place for my burrito fix. The other Mexican restaurant down the street used to be good till they changed the name and apparently how they make the food. Zona Rosa has been consistently good over the 10 + years I have been coming here. Long lines, fast service with maybe a little attitude that I can't complain about this is a place I can come back to over and over again. Can't go wrong with the California or super burrito. Long live Zona Rosa!
author: Joshua B.

description: This place is a total dive but they make a decent burrito if you have a craving in the Haight. I've been here many times over the years and it seems like their quality has been declining over the years. However, it gets the job done for me when all I want is a massive burrito stuffed with crap that'll expand my waistline and fatten my ass. Their burritos guarantee a food coma and at least 5 minutes where you can't move your ass up out of your seat. All that for the low price of around $6 is a-ok in my book.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Zona Rosa located in the Upper Haight near Cha-Cha-Cha and Amoeba I find quite decent.I must say I read some reviews and thought maybe I should try out this place.Not for a burrito,but for something like chicken tacos.As I type this,well maybe I shouldn't have decided on the chicken tacos,but something different I have yet to try and encourage people to explore also(sorry).

I must say the chips were tasty(not store brand taste),guacamole was indeed tasty.The chicken wasn't shredded,but was decent in my taco and I must say filled with ingredients.


I think if you are in the area,hungry and on the go this place may be worth a try.I know there are other places in the area,but hey this might be a new place you can try out(new experiences,right).

Note: The place was quite empty and it was early,so didn't see many strays...oops,did I word that right,well homeless individuals inside like someone stated.

4 stars for guacamole,chips,decent tacos,not a long line and the people who work here were polite.
author: Dani D.

description: Yummy food, friendly service, and most importantly...delicious guacamole!
author: Ottilia S.

description:
I guess you can say I have a burrito addiction.  My roommates used to make fun of me for this, however this has waned since we moved and I now live too far from Zona Rosa to go everyday.  

I consider Zona Rosa the *best* burrito place in the city.  I know we have our Il Farolito and Papolito lovers, but hear me out!  

I'm what you call a minimalist burrito eater.  The only thing I like in my large (and in charge) tortilla are beans and cheese.  Therefore, these two ingredients must be pretty damn good.  Zona Rosa does just this.  

Amen.
author: Jeni D.

description: Been a favorite since I was a kid. Fucking epic burrito. Lots of extras, if you are into that. I'll still opt for a simple Mission Burrito, but if I am at the Park or in the Haight, I will gladly devour a burrito here.
author: Joanna M.

description:
I spent my teen years in Boston and my best friend's mom is a Bay Area native, so I spent years and years hearing that someday, we absolutely HAD to go to Zona Rosa, that it was the best burrito place ever.

Over time, he's found a better burrito, but, finally, this last Thursday, a decade came full circle and we went to Zona Rosa while I was in town for some interviews.  Zona Rosa is certainly costlier than other Taquerias that we went to but we're talking like a dollar more; negligible.  I did have a better burrito while I was in the Mission, but that doesn't detract from the fact that the burrito I got here was still pretty freakin' good.  The ingredients were great, and fresh enough considering that it was a taqueria... the salsa tasted like it'd been made not long beforehand, as did the guac.  I got my vegetarian burrito in their wet, enchilada-style with melted cheese on top and it was damned great.  After I move up there, I'll definitely be back.

As a bonus, Giant Robot is right around the corner, so, I'm stoked that I'll be able to get my insufferable indie-kid comics and art collections and digest them as I indulge in a great burrito.
author: Tristan S.

description:
I rate Mexican places based on the salsa. The red salsa that's on the tables here is the absolute best in my opinion. It's the right amount of hot combined with wonderful flavor. It's more of a hot sauce than a pico de gallo, but they put the pico on the nachos. I give it 5 stars.

The prices seem pretty high for a burrito and one time my boyfriend got a big chunk of glass in his burrito. Despite that, we still return because I'm a fan of the salsa. So sue me for being a bad person...
author: Mandy K.

description:
My favorite burrito in SF hands down. And I've gotten them EVERYWHERE. I will DRIVE there and look for parking in order to eat there. 
I suggest the California burrito with no cheese, sub guac. The burrito is a little dry without the guac. The buritto mojado is another winner. It's like diving into a mexican food tower of goodness.
